item.title: Library: More Than Books, The Infrastructure of Equality in a City
item.description: We only realize the absence of some things in our lives when we encounter them for the first time. A void we thought was normal for years suddenly makes us say “I have been deprived of this all along”. Is it possible to feel the absence of something you have never had? Sometimes, the lack of something only makes sense when you truly see its presence.
